oai_dc:dc.dc:title: US Model 1863 Springfield Rifle-Musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Model 1863 Springfiled Rifle-Musket was made on contract by Colt Manufacturing and issued primarily to garrison troops, United States Colored Troops, or Federal units raised late in the war. This weapon was handed down through a Morgan County, Tenn. family with the story that it had been carried by an uncle in the Union Army during the Civil War. The ramrod is a post-war replacemnet. Accompanying the weapon is the original Springfield pattern bayonet.
